sen.j: 1331年（元弘元年）の元弘の変で鎌倉幕府の討幕計画が露見し捕縛されて隠岐島に流罪となっていた後醍醐天皇が、1333年（元弘3年/正慶2年）に島を脱出すると、これを船上山（鳥取県東伯郡琴浦町）に迎え、討幕運動に加わる。
sen.e: Emperor Godaigo planned an anti-Shogunate movement to attack Kamakura bakufu (Japanese feudal government headed by a shogun), but the plan was disclosed and thus Emperor Godaigo was caught to be exiled to Oki no shima Island (the Genko War of 1331); when he escaped from the island in 1333, Nagatoshi welcomed Emperor Godaigo in Mt. Senjo (Kotoura-cho, Tohaku District, Tottori Prefecture) and joined to the anti-Shogunate movement.

sen.j: 幕府滅亡後に後醍醐天皇により開始された建武の新政において、河内国の豪族楠木正成らとともに天皇近侍の武士となり、記録所や武者所、恩賞方や雑訴決断所などの役人を務め、帆掛け船の家紋を与えられる。
sen.e: After the destruction of the bakufu, Emperor Godaigo inaugurated Kenmu Restoration, where Nagatoshi became a samurai valet to serve the emperor together with Masashige KUSUNOKI, Gozoku (local ruling family) in Kawachi Province, and served as officers, including Kirokujo (Land Record Office), Mushadokoro (place where Samurai of guard of the Imperial Palace is staffed), Onshokata (office to do desk works of Onsho award), and Zasso-Ketsudansho (agency of Kenmu government to file lawsuits); he was awarded a family crest of a sailboat.

sen.j: 足利尊氏が、信濃国で北条時行らが蜂起して鎌倉を一時占領した中先代の乱の討伐を契機に建武政権から離脱すると、楠木正成、新田義貞らと共に宮方として尊氏と戦うが、1336年（延元元年/建武3年）の湊川の戦いの後に京都に入った尊氏に敗れ、三条猪隈で討死する。
sen.e: When Takauji ASHIKAGA deserted from the Kenmu Government after suppressing Nakasendai War in which Tokiyuki HOJO rose up in revolt in Shinano Province and temporarily occupied Kamakura, Nagatoshi battled against Takauji, supporting Court with Masashige KUSUNOKI and Yoshisada NITTA; however, he was defeated by Takauji who entered Kyoto after the Battle of Minatogawa in 1336, and was killed in Sanjo Inokuma.
